page.title: 01Morley, in Suffolk
page.content:
The village of Morley is made up of the parishes of Morley St.Peter and Morley St.Botolph. It is on the main road from Norwich to London and is midway between the towns of Wymondham (pronounced Wind-ham) and Attleborough. Most of the land in the area is used for farming, predominantly arable. The main employers in the village are the Norfolk Agricultural station and Wymondham College, although many villagers work in Wymondham or Norwich. A few villagers are self employed in trades such as building, and there is a sawmill in the village and one village shop/post office.
SC21CS
